My sister got the #14 SPICY PORK BULGOGI and my dad had the #15 BEEF BULGOGI, which Mr. Lee recommended for him. Both these orders came on sizzling platters and both were enjoyed. We also got the #10 JAPCHAE, a type of glass noodle dish, similar to the Filipinos' pansit sotanghon. Small side dishes of kimchi, cucumbers, bean sprouts, and tofu were included and refillable. For the 3 of us, our tab came out to $45, which is not bad at all. Go visit!

First time here,  and I would go back.  The food was tasty and refreshing.  The meal started off with a complimentary soup that was full of unexpected amazing tasty flavors.  I had the fish katsu ,  and it was crunchy and fresh . I am normally a picky eater,  and would of not came if my girlfriend didn't have meal choice today,  but I am glad she dragged me a long.

Prior to going to the movies, Earl and I had dinner here.  When we arrived, there was one other table that was finishing up.  We shared the fried dumplings which comes with a bowl of rice, seaweed salad, and pickled radish.  The dumplings were good, but didn't quite go with the seaweed and the Japanese pickled radish.

Earl got the tofu stew with seafood.  Initially, we were going to go with the kimchi and beef, but Mr. Lee recommended the seafood because it has more flavor.  We were so happy with the tofu stew.

Our meal came with the following banchan: kimchi, zucchini, tofu, and bean sprouts.  I didn't care for those banchan because they haven't reach that fermentation that I would liked it to be.

We were also given a bowl of cream of chicken soup.  This was delicious.  I would order this if it was on the menu.  Our meal ended with free strawberry mocha icecream.

Also, we ordered bottled water that came when we were finishing up dinner.

Overall, the food was awesome and the service was great, taking into account that this small spot is served and managed by only Mr. and Mrs. Lee.  Mr. Lee is very funny and we will definitely return.
Very friendly!! Food was delicious! I had the spicy tuna roll & my husband had the pork bolgogi (which I tried and was really good)!! Very friendly staff! Will be back again! Thank you!

4 stars - This place is solid. 
I wanted to visit this place a couple times before I wrote my review.  Here are my thoughts. 

Food- Its made fresh every time and it's delicious. Yes they have run out of things but like others have mentioned it is owned and operated by a husband and wife team. Very often we have been given a complimentary starter soup and omelette both of which are delicious. Recommendations are the soondubu, rice balls ( tofu pockets stuffed with seasoned rice), and Kalbi. 

Service- The service can be slow but they are pleasant and kind people. Our only issue is the wait time but because the food is made by his wife alone and it's fresh it is understandable. Let them know if you need to leave by a certain time or don't go there if you're under time constraints. 

People have commented on the ambience/decor, yes it may be lacking however this is not fine dining and they don't pretend to be. You're there to eat good food, and they provide a good atmosphere for just that.

As soon as we came in, the husband and wife duo were serving us homemade cream chicken soup (on the house). After everyone but us had left, they continued serving us free pan fried noodles and told us if we wanted more to just ask. They were extremely accommodating and kind people who opened this restaurant to SERVE. This place is a must try, the beef bulgogi is amazing!
They had a really good food here, also the side dishes. I had a Spicy Grilled Chicken...it was delicious

This place is a little gem and what made it better is that it is a mom and pop shop. When we enter we was greeted by a adorable grandma and was seated right away. Their lunch menu is a great price and they had so many options to chose from. We ordered the noodles, beef bulgogi and the katsu. First they gave us chicken soup. It was delicious and I wanted more. It tasted just like the type of soup i would get when I was a kid. When the food came out everything was delicious and flavorful. Our favorite was the soup and the noodles. We couldn't stop eating it. I was so full from the noodles and I couldn't eat my bulgogi anymore. the husband would keep asking if we wanted more side dishes. They acted like my grandparents when we ate at their house. I felt like they was feeding one of their own grandchild and making sure we ate enough. They were very sweet and we will for sure come back.

This mom and pops restaurant is delicious. They might not have the greatest service because it is just the two of them and they both do no speak English well, but the food makes up for it. 

My sister and I came in for lunch and ordered off the lunch special menu. We shared a "Mo deum jeon" which came with one platter of food, 2 side dishes, and two bowls of rice. Also, Mr. Lee brought out two small bowls of a homemade creamy, chicken soup as an appetizer. Everything was very flavorful, authentic, and healthy. 

If you are craving homemade Korean food, this is the place.

Can i write over 5 stars because the service was amazing! Super clean and friendly owners. It was my first time last week and they were super awesome! Food was great; so many side dishes for FREE! Best japche noodles I've ever had. Will come back over and over cuz of the yummy food and the best customer service!

If you want good Korean food, this is the place to go. The owner checked on us several times and had to turn guests away 30 minutes before closing because they sadly ran out of food. Come early so you don't miss out.

I want to love this place. I love the people, and i like the food, and im so so on the location and decor. 

Ill break this up into two parts, the good and the bad. So the good is the same that everybody has talked about, as the couple are the sweetest people and genuinely want you to enjoy your food and leave satisfied. I mean how many places bring you samples of food for you to try even after your full from your meal? Not many and that gives me the feel of going home to my grandmother who never wants to stop feeding me. Both husband and wife were very nice, especially my interaction with the husband with my limited Korean we really had a nice conversation.

The bad but not totally bad is the location is certainly not setup for date night or anything more that a super casual location/spot. And its just the two that run the place, so the wait for your bill, food, drink etc could take a little bit as its hard to be demanding of such a genuine gentleman trying to keep the front of the house. Last thing that was sort of a negative to me was that when i heard of a mom/pop spot with Korean food i thought traditional comfort food. Maybe some jajangmyeon, galbi jjim, or something other than the standard fair like Kalbi, Bulgogi, and bibimbap offerings. 

I wouldnt make a special trip, but if your in the area and want a good lunch at a good price and time isnt an issue. Stop on by as im sure you will be pleased like so many others.

This is an awesome place. Greeted and seated immediately. Love the couple that run the place. So nice and they make you feel like you are eating at a friend or family members home instead of a restaurant. First they serve you this creamy chicken soup that is complimentary, then they take your order. I had been here before and ordered the korean meatballs, but I did not see it on the dinner menu but when I asked about it, the gentleman said I could still order it for dinner. We also got he spicy pork, comes out on a sizzling platter and just the right amount of spice. Traditional sides came with it and then the cook comes out with a bowl of chopchae (korean fried noodles), she said complimentary service, it was amazing, not oily how some place make it. All in all, wonderful service and great korean food. Will be back

I was really excited to eat here. Unfortunately, I never got the chance to as I was turned away at the door.

In the owner's defense, the place was full, and even though a group had just left, he would've had to clear a table before I could sit, but I was never given the option to wait.

He just stood beside his "We retain the right to refuse service to anyone" sign, and told me that they could not serve me.

Best korean food I've had in the states yet. Much like everyone has agreed, it is a literal mom and pop shop and they are very giving. After ordering my tofu soup, he gave me a free sample of thier beef stir fry. Everything tasted amazing and after I was done he even offered to refill my plates for free. It felt like visiting family by the way they interracted with people and the serving portions they offered. If I wasn't visiting this town I wouldve deffinately been frequenting this restuarant.
The couple that run this place are a little disorganized, but they try very hard to please. I enjoyed everything.  The pace is a bit slow, so this is a place that's best if you can spend some time.

Be prepared to be treated like family and given 17 times the amount of food you originally ordered. This place is so great! The food has the best flavor and all of the little "good digestion" extras keep your tummy super happy.

I wish I lived in this state so I could come visit these lovely people everyday. One things for sure I will be coming here every single time I'm in town.

We were excited to try a new sushi place.  However, we encountered a few problems when we arrived that caused us to leave without ordering.

After seating us, the staff ignored us for several minutes, despite the fact that there were only a few guests in the restaurant.  We had to flag down a server to take our drink order.  She refused to give us tap water, stating that she could only serve us bottled water, which she had to charge for.  When it came to ordering food, she refused to honor a coupon we had, claiming that ownership had changed.  Why not do the right thing and honor the coupon anyway to try to make sure guests have a good experience at your new restaurant?

Since we received poor service and were nickel and dimed twice right off the bat, we decided to leave rather than order, and went to another sushi place down the block, where we had a much better experience.

Great food and service. Complimentary soup was wonderful along with everything we had. We tried a Dragon roll, beef bolgogi and the owner brought out a noodle dish that was divine. All the sides were so tasty!  The attentive service really made our experience special. We will definitely be back!
I must say that this place really has changed. The food and service are fantastic. Maybe a little bit slow. But so worth the wait.

The halmoni and halapoji running the show are so sweet, sweet, sweet. They brought over a bunch of the usual Korean starters and even some homemade chicken soup (which was AMAZING) and sweetened rice drink for us. 
The restaurant is small (~5 tables) and a little run down from the outside, don't be turned away! 
We ordered bulgogi (served on hot stone like it should be!) kalbi and japchae from the lunch menu. All three were great-- my favorite was the japchae. Both the bulgogi and japchae had the perfect vegetables to meat/noodle ratio! 
Finally a decent Korean restaurant in Henderson! I'll be back.

Probably the best Korean place I've been to since moving from LA to LV.

I had the japchae and bulgogi.  The banchan was delicious and properly fermented and seasoned.  Both the japchae and bulgogi had so many vegetables you rarely see in them except when you make them yourself at home.  The japchae had 2 different mushrooms, fresh scallions, seasoned beef, carrots (my mouth is watering just thinking of it again) and was made to order.  The bulgogi was prepared with carrots, mushrooms, and onions.  At other restaurants, I only see onions and a ton of sugar to try and mask the old meat taste.  But the bulgogi I had at this place was fresh and the colors were aesthetically pleasing (in addition to tasting delicious haha).

It is indeed a mom and pop operation and as a medical student who misses Korean food this hit the spot.  Mr. Lee is very attentive and very entertaining.

Apparently, the couple started the restaurant because they felt idle living with their children in Boston so they up and moved to Henderson.  Mr. Lee also told me that he is a retired chemical engineer and doesn't add sugar or MSG to the food (I agree that they don't add any of those things... the food tastes naturally sweet and there isn't the gross aftertaste of MSG).

When I left, Mr. Lee said to come back any time I missed Korean food but not every day. Haha!
Good is delicious and one of the only Korean restaurants with Kimbap...... So good!! The owners work hard and are very friendly.m!!
A must go spot if you like Korean food.  A little hard to find but next to Trader Joes.

Incredible experience. Great mom-and-pop shop and the gentleman takes a great deal of time with people. The food is incredible and he is very attentive with his customers. I will happily return. 
Definitely recommend!

Can i say.. This is my go to place for Korean BBQ! 

I've passed this place a few times when I used to work in the area, but I never really paid attention. It's been years and this was when it was still M sushi. I was greeted by Mr. Lee and his wife and right away, I knew I was going to love the place. Mr Lee is so kind and you can really tell he cares about his customers. He cared enough to get to know me and even if it was small talk, It made my day. His wife immediately distributed my soup while i waited for my boyfriend. I saw other yelpers say that the food was going to take longer because it is a husband and wife team , so I automatically ordered. It took less than 10 minutes for my food and they even offered us complimentary noodles! what place offers you authentic and free food? It was just the two of us so the couple offered us some privacy. Mr Lee would check on us from time to time and encouraged to eat as much as we can. Not many places even care enough to see if you're happy with the meal that was given to you. We left knowing that we'll be back soon. Mr Lee, if you read this.. Keep up the great work from you and your wife!

No MSG, no artificial flavoring. It's like eating mom's food in Henderson. Everything is so amazingly delicious and the owners are generous and friendly beyond your wildest imagination. A must try restaurant if you're craving Korean food in Vegas!

This is a true mom & pop ran Korean restaurant. 
They do it all, serve, cook and socialize between everything else.
the menu is basic, but covers the basics... with a few rolls tossed in.

The food was great, very much homemade style, almost as my wife's halmoni would make.
The service is great, and you feel like they want to make sure your food and time there is a good experience.

a must try if you need a kimchi fix.
We will be back, and often.

Back when this place was called M Sushi my wife and I would visit every once in a great while, now that the Lee's have taken ownership and started serving authentic homemade Korean food I think we'll be here every week. 

Our first visit was fantastic and was an experience unlike any other restaurant I've ever been to. Before they even brought us a menu they were bringing us food. Even after we'd ordered they continued to bring us other foods to try (just to be clear, they only charged us for what we ordered). It's like when someone discovers something great and they tell everybody "you have to try this"! That's how the Lee's are about their own cooking. The food is fantastic and the Lee's are amazing hosts. They are so kind and so genuine and serve such good food! 

I highly recommend the Korean Pancakes, the kimchi fried rice and the pork bulgogi (a big sizzling plate of seasoned bbq pork that was just amazing)!

UPDATE: We've been back here many times now and have tried numerous dishes, none of which have disappointed. The Korean Stir Fried Noodles are great, the pan fried white fish is great, even the steamed rice is great! How do they make steamed white rice taste better than any other white rice I've ever had?!?

We went in for lunch a few days after New Years and after we had finished eating Mr. Lee came out with another meal in a to-go box for us to bring home to my wife's mother. They know us by name and they even know my mother-in-law well enough to think of her when she's not with us. Where else can you get that kind of service? 

Don't go there when you are in a rush, it won't be the same. Go there when you have time to truly enjoy your meal along with a healthy dose of true, old-fashioned, authentic hospitality and camaraderie.

Mr. & Mrs Lee do an amazing job! Their food is beyond delicious! Our stomachs and taste buds are overloaded with joy! 
Very great customer service. We felt like family while enjoying the food and listening to Mr. Lees' story. 
Don't expect speed to get your food but the wait is very worth it!!!! Everything is hand made from scratch. You can really taste the love that goes into the healthy food. 

YOU WONT BE DISAPPOINTED AT ALL!! 

Thank you for your hospitality Mr. & Mrs Lee! 
-The Francisco's

I ordered the galbi, and my wife had bulgogi. Both dishes were excellent. The owners were very attentive and so sweet with our son (he loved the chicken soup). We love coming to Korean BBQ and Rolls every time we are in Vegas. To the owners, thank you for your hospitality and kindness. We will be back!

This food will blow your mind!  The restaurant is small but it's so worth the wait.  We tried basically everything because it was just one great dish after another, we had spicy pork bulgogi, leek pancake, stir fry rice noodles with beef, kimchi fries rice and dumplings...all fabulous!  The owners are the chef and wait staff and are very friendly, they make the visit extra special.

Awesome hole-in-the-wall kind of place! They serve authentic Korean food, taste so yummy. I was 110% satisfied with the food and service. The owners are so humble and friendly. I would recommend this to anyone who knows and loves Korean!

Absolutely fabulous. Picked up daughter at airport and wanted something other than fast food.  Read about this place on YELP and it did not disappoint.  My only regret is that I live in another state.  Arrived around 4 pm on a Friday, we were the only customers, but greeted with a smile and seated.  The owner, filled us in on the benefits of Korean food, fermination, his life story, and selected our meal for us as we were both new to Korean cuisine.  His wife the cook is a jewel.  The cream of chicken soup is my new comfort food and I actually found myself eating all the little relishesm which I normally eschew.  When we left another couple of people had arrived so I hope they are able to stay in business.  Prices are reasonable.  Do not miss this opportunity.

Although I can see big areas this place can work on if you come here with a little patience in mind it is well worth the wait. With a little help and time this place will be extremely successful. It's got a really sweet and adorable mom and pop feel and the food is absolutely amazing and the prices make it even better. They gave us a free creamy chicken soup appetizer and during our meal a big portion of the stir fry noodles and when I got the receipt turns out he didn't even charge me for the rice tea he gave us and I got two servings and he gave me a double portion to go which I was super happy about. The bulgogi was the best I've ever had and so was the Kalbi. The Korean pancakes with the imitation crab in it was delicious. Hands down the best Korean food I've had period. Mr. Lee is extremely nice and was extremely personable and super sweet and really made the experience overall awesome. I would go there everytime I eat out if it wasn't so far from home. 
Overall I would really like to see the owners get some signage. 
The thing about this place is you really have to just go in there with a different attitude. Come in as if you were going to your grandmas house for dinner and you will have an amazing experience. Don't expect super fast quick service and you may have to ask for a thing or two but it's well worth it. They are so sweet and hard working its a place that make you feel good for going to for so many different reasons.

This place is great. It's run by the sweetest and polite Korean couple.... I was in the neighborhood and starving. Went on yelp and read the reviews and decided to try it. The restaurant it's really small, plain and only a couple of tables. I was greeted by a cute little old Korean lady... She was so polite and immediately got us our menu and thank me and my friend for coming. She took our order without writing it down and got it right. She even told us not to order too much food because it would be to much for us to finish. While she cooked the meals her husband washed the dishes and would checked up on us and kept saying how his wife was the best cook ever and he was completely right.. Really great home tasting food. Will definitely be coming back even it it's not near my neighborhood.

This restaurant is a true mom and pop operation that you can tell is a labor of love on the part of owners, Mr. & Mrs. Lee.  I suspect as retired professionals, he an engineer and she a nurse, they are not financially dependent on the success of the restaurant.  She does most of the cooking while he serves and talks.  We decided to share orders of Korean style stir fry noodles and BBQ chicken.  

While waiting for our entrees, we were given complimentary cups of a delicious creamy chicken soup.  Next came 4 tiny servings of banchan - kimchee, pickled vegetable, seaweed salad and seasoned mung bean sprouts.  This was followed by a pair of rice balls, a salmon salad plus larger portions of both kimchee and seaweed salad followed by our entrees  Everything was homemade and delicious.  Prior to departing, cups of a refreshing cold rice tea were brought to our table.  Being the recipients of such generosity and graciousness, I felt compelled to offer to help with the dishes or at least to sweep up the floor, but Mr. Lee kindly declined my offer so I substituted a generous gratuity.
This place is so good. By far the best Korean restaurant I have ever been to and experienced. The owners are awesome and the food is so authentic and delicous. I highly recommend this place. Love it!

Very small and neat mom-and-pop shop with excellent food.  The restaurant is on the small, I mean very small, side, with only about 10 tables and the personality of a typical whole in the wall sort of place.  The service, as other have mentioned, is somewhat slow as the mom and pop are the only people who seem to work there.  Mom makes the food and pop serves it.  That being said, it is impossible to be upset with the service because the man is so nice and welcoming and he wants you to enjoy all of your food.  The extra dish of food he brings out for you to try, we had the Jap Chae, was so good and the fermented rice drink is also a pleasant  end to the meal.  While this place is listed at a $ I do not think that is totally accurate.  Most menu items are more than $10, though you could technically eat for under $10 per person I think you would still be hungry.  Despite the creamy chicken soup, hot pot Bim Bi Bap that I had as well as the sides, Jap Chae, and fermented rice drink, I was still hungry when I left.  Just not enough foot for me.  I will still be back though for the friendly service and the little free goodies that you get.
This place is amazing! Quiet atmosphere and delicious food at a great price. We will definitely be back :)

Small hidden gem on Sunset and Green Valley. The outside sign still says M Sushi. Went in for the lunch special and food was YUMMY. We could hear other patrons saying the same things. There are some great extra things include din the lunch special - an opening soup and then after you're done with the main meal, some jap chae (clear noodles) and some type of semisweet rice drink.

I had the pork cutlet (tonkatsu) which was lean and not greasy. My fiancé had the beef bulgogi - very generous portions and also lean. She grew up in Korea and was very impressed with the food. 

We'll definitely stop by again. Thanks for the great food and service!
Love this place! The owner couple are the nicest people I have ever encountered. Super sweet and offers you free samples and yummy soup every time. They treat you like family, the more you come!

Another wonderful mom-and-pop hole-in-the-wall restaurant. It's no coincidence that these places tend to have great food and customer service. You can really taste the love they put into their food, and the owners are two of the nicest people I've met in the service industry.

I came here with a friend for lunch, and we hadn't eaten all day, so we ordered a bunch of food. The owner seemed quite pleased, and he even offered us some extra food, on the house! They also give every customer a small dish of creamy chicken soup to start, which was delicious. As was everything else. My two personal highlights were the bibimbap and the tofu soup.

I would definitely recommend this place if you like Korean food and a friendly, relaxing atmosphere. I just wish I lived closer, so I could go more often!

It's rare that you receive both outstanding food AND service. You can feel the love these people have for their culture. The flavors of the dishes were out of this world. Everything was fresh and tasted incredible. You can tell they take pride in the quality of food they put out. The hospitality is enough to practically bring you to tears. It was an absolute pleasure to dine here. Can't wait to come back!
Mom and pop restaurant. Nothing fancy but it feels warm and cozy. I work close by so this will be my favorite spot from now

An enjoyable understated affair!  This is a very modest, very homey place.  Whereas it may lack in decor and ambiance, is more than made up by the friendliness of the owners and their wonderful home cooked food!

Ambiance - Very undecorated and very plain.
Menu - Simple, basic foods with a bit of variety.
Food - Very, very nice and the servings are very large!

a. Korean Fried Rice - Very fresh and tasty. Plenty of chunks of beef, although you could have ordered it with pork also. I think it was almost made right to order.

b.  SoonDobu - The soft tofu came with a raw egg and sizzling hot to the point it was still boiling. I ordered it to the hottest spice level and it was mild to me, and yet very good at the same time.  This Soondobu was full of tofu and pork and kimchi.  It was almost like a stew. I definitely felt i got my money's worth.

c.  Pork Bulgogi - Normally have Beef, but the son ordered this and it was very tasty. Comes on a hot plate and sizzling. All the pork is laying atop a bed of chopped cabbage that is great to absorb all the juices and makes the veggies more tasty.

d.  Korean Roll - This is nearly identical to the Hawaiian rolls that my wife always has when relatives come over and the taste brought back some great memories of family and Hawaii. Not too many places make this and I really enjoyed it.

e.  Jop Chae - Just when we thought we were done, the owner brings out an order of Job Chae as a gift.  Loved the glassy noodles and the al dente texture. A great meal itself and on the menu it is I believe it is over 9.00 for this dish.

When  you first sit down, you will get a small bowl of home made creamy chicken soup.  You will get some very fresh banchan that is very simple and tasty. For dessert, they will give you a cup of a sweet drink.

The service is wonderful, the food satisfying. While it may not be the best ever Korean Food, and may not be the best ever decor, the service, the family, the home style makes this place a special place and one to go back to many times!
It's an old Korean man serve us he was nice, I actually love this place it's good! The guy was nice, kept giving us complimentary food I loved it ! And we just ordered tofu soup & galbi as usual

I am a fan of this restaurant.  It has very good galbi, beef bulgogi, and spicy pork bulgogi.  Also the service is outstanding.  The Korean couple that own and run this place are super friendly and helpful.  They go out of their way to make sure you have an enjoyable experience.  So I strongly suggest you give it a try.

We came here on a Sunday afternoon just before noon, and there were only two tables of customers. Walked in, we didn't get acknowledged for at least 3 minutes so we decided to just sit down. We didn't know the routine so a customer actually helped us out and gave us a menu. Eventually the owner came and told us one was lunch menu and one was dinner menu. We flipped through the menus and waited, another 10 minutes went by and still waiting, no water or anything, and at that point, we were just so turned off by the entire experience that we just left.

I understand that it's a wife and husband team managing the whole place, but come on, what kind of non existent customer service is that? I love Korean food and was really looking forward to trying this place out because of the good reviews, but we will never return. Not worth the stress.

This place is so cute and the owners are so, so nice.  The food was great and they brought 3 complimentary sides (in addition to the condiments)
Go for lunch until 2:30, it's a great value
Love this place! Perfect hole-in-the-wall atmosphere with delicious BBQ. The couple who owns it is adorable and hospitable. Dumplings are amazing

Little hidden secret in the Green Valley area. Place is owned and operated by a husband and wife team. She cooks, he serves. Came here for lunch and was served soup with the lunch special. The food is definitely excellent and tastes homemade.

I was craving Korean food and stopped at this hidden spot next to Trader Joe's off Green Valley Pkway.  The owners are very nice and came out with a chicken cream soup.. which was good. I ordered Galbi and Japchae and it was okay.. love the owners... wanna luv the food too, but its a place i would come if i was in the area only

The place for delicious Korean food. Wait time for food may seem long since the owner's wife cooks all orders but totally worth the wait. The owner is entertaining and attentive---such an impeccable customer service.

I have only been here once, but do plan on going back again sometime very soon. For the past month I have been craving Korean BBQ and decided to try this place with a friend who hasn't tried it before. 

She ordered the Pork Katsu and I ordered the Beef Bulgolgi. Not long after we ordered we were presented with appetizers that come with dining in: kimchi, fish cake, this egg dish with onion and carrot, and cucumber kimchi(do not know the actual name of it). I have never really been to big on kimchi, mainly due to the smell, so I passed on the appetizers. My friend however loved the kimchi and the cucumber, she left no trace of them on the table.

Upon arrival, my bulgolgi plate was literally steaming. Cabbage topped with the meat, all on a sizzling hot plate. The flavor was amazing, and the quality of the ingredients is hard to beat. My friend was equally impressed with her food. The pork was breaded with panko crumbs, which was very, very light (she let me try a piece ;) ), and came served with red radish and seaweed. Both had a sort of sweet flavor that I was really impressed with, especially since I don't exactly have either of them too often.
The restaurant is run by a wonderful elderly couple, who say they do not do this for the money, purely for the passion, and it really shows in the food. They really care about the quality and freshness of the ingredients and make sure that every bit of food you receive serves it's purpose.

I plan on coming again real soon to try some more!

I had driven past this place quite a few times, but the poorly lit  "M Sushi"  sign failed to spark the slightest bit of curiosity in me. It wasn't until a couple months later, I was looking for some damn-good bibimbap and stumbled across this place as an option. I was completely stumped. What?! A japanese sushi joint with bomb korean food?! Hmm... still decided to give it a try. My boyfriend and I were greeted by the most cordial gentlemen and we were seated immediately. Although the inside of the restaurant reminded me of a grab-and-go teriyaki spot, the service throughout our dining experience was comparable to none other than the kitchen of my Asian grandmother. We were looking at  the menu, and the gentleman (whom I later learned to be the owner of the restaurant) brought us korean pancakes for an appetizer. No, we didn't order them, but they were pretty darn delicious (and free!). They were made courtesy of his wife, the cook. After finishing them, we were offered more, but declined.... we were ready to eat. I ordered bibimbop and my boyfriend got the kimchii rice. Neither of the two fell short of complete satisfaction. Of course, we also received the 4-5 korean side dishes, typical to most restaurants of the sort. All very traditional and tasty! A couple of the sides (the potato and the cabbage) were devoured quicker than the others, and we were promptly offered free "refills". Our waiter/host seemed to care most that we were satisfied and FULL before leaving, which is very commendable. He was surely not disappointed, because he and his wife filled us to our limits! After our appetizers, plentiful sides and generous entrees we were given some type of sweet fermented rice drink. I had never had it before, but it was amazing (oh, and we were given free refills!!). 

The name, M Sushi, made absolutely no sense. I think I may have seen a couple of generic sushi rolls on the menu, but the place was definitely Korean. I was happy to learn that they have successfully merged their menu to be completely Korean and the new name, Korean BBQ & Rolls, seems far more fitting. If you are from Hawaii and have high standards for korean bbq, you will not be disappointed, trust me! The service, in and of itself, deserves the highest rating possible on yelp! Please support this local Mom&Pop joint!

It was my first time eating here, and I absolutely enjoyed my experience at this cute, humble Korean restaurant. The owners are a adorable elderly husband & wife duo who are super friendly and make you feel at home. The husband is the front of the house, and the wife works in the kitchen. They provide great customer service and will happily attend to your needs! I commend those who are happy on their jobs.

You can tell they are probably new to owning a business in the restaurant industry. I wasn't asked if I wanted something to drink, although if you ask them they will be quick to serve you. The restaurant is quiet and small with minimal decor, and there are only 5 tables, but don't let that turn you away. Their food and service quality are WORTH IT.

They put out the creamy chicken soup first, along with the basic side dishes. The soup was savory, delicious and the perfect amount for a starter dish. I ordered the kimchi fried rice and it was amazing and of homemade quality. It was $9, but the portion was big and it could easily feed 2 people. The wife gave me a free serving of japchae, which was equally as delicious.

I'm happy to say I will be coming back. :) The owners have my heart, and I am in love with this place already.

What surprises most people when eating Korean cuisine for the first time is the banchan -- the sides of pickled vegetables and other goodies brought to the table to accompany the meal. Its something you didn't expect, and in some respects is like a complimentary appetizer. Korean BBQ & Rolls takes it to the next level. The owners (a delightful husband and wife team) set down two plates with 6 different pickled vegetables. This was, however, preceded by a bowl of creamy chicken soup. After the pickled vegetables came a grilled salmon salad, and finally came pajeon (a thin scallion pancake). And this was all the stuff we didn't pay for (directly). It was all delicious. The salmon was still tender and flaky (a hair overdone, but that's just nitpicking). The kimchi was tart and perfectly seasoned (and homemade!).
For the main dishes, I was able to sample the bulgogi, pork katsu (they have a Japanese flare as well, probably to attract more business), the jap chae, the bibimbap, and the kimchi fried rice. You won't be disappointed with any of those, and likely not with anything else on the menu as well. I ordered the kimchi fried rice, and it is a very flavorful, hearty dish. If you're hungry its a good meal. If not, it's two good meals. The bulgogi is some of the best I've ever had.
After dinner, we were treated to a cup of sikhye (a sweetened fermented rice drink). Delicious, of course... and complimentary.
If you like variety, you'll get to try around 10 different dishes just for ordering a single entree. It'll run you like $12-$15. You'll also get the best service around. Other than ambiance, there is really nothing bad to say about Korean BBQ & Rolls.

Seriously you must go! The best Korean food in Las Vegas! The Japchae is the most tasty item on the menu. I was given it for free to taste. When I told the owner it was so good he gave me another free serving of it! The cream of chicken appetizer was also tasty. If you are in Vegas you must go to try this place. The owner treats you like a friend and makes you leave full, even if you didn't pay for some items, a true home feeling!Now if only they expanded and had all you can eat BBQ. Other than that this place is a Korean food heaven!

This was THE coziest restaurant! I felt just like home. The elderly couple who owns this place were so welcoming and kind. Since it's just the two of them working, service isn't the fastest but the food was very fresh and light!  

We first got served complimentary creamy chicken soup which was absolutely delicious! I asked for seconds. My friends and I then got the Mo Deum Jeon lunch special which came with a bowl of rice  and banchan for $9.50. My favorite part was the crabmeat and scallion pancake. The lunch also had shrimp, pork pancakes and pollack pancakes. They have a variety of other lunch boxes to choose from too for any craving you have! The portions itself weren't the largest but the owner kindly gave us free jap chae to try which was delicious as well! 

Overall, this is a very quaint and peaceful restaurant that's perfect for a cozy lunch (I just wish the prices were a bit cheaper!). Just be aware that service might not be the fastest!

Absolutely Loved This Place...
Read the reviews on Yelp and needed to give this place a try.  We were staying at the Courtyard (Henderson-Green Valley), which is right across the street.  The owner was very nice and very helpful, pointing out a few items he thought we might like and suggesting that we share a single meal.  He was right about the sharing.  We got two meals (wanted different things) and it was WAY too much food.  The meals were not flavorful and perfectly cooked.  The meat (Galbi) was so tender it melted in your mouth.  The sides (vegetables) were great, though I have no idea what they were.  My travel partner had the Korean Meatball patties and really enjoyed them as well.

All in all, I would absolutely go back any time I am in Vegas.

Friendly mom and pop type restaurant.  Very small but very family style.  Run by husband and wife... Very good and tasty food- no msg used so that's a total bonus!  They first greet you with a dish of creamy chicken soup... Almost like minced chicken with a corn chowder like broth.  We had the spicy pork, bbq chicken, chop chae, dragon roll, and steamed mandoo.  Everything is prepared by the wife... While the husband greats and takes orders and is your server.  They are very friendly and it feels like you're in their home and they're hosting you.  We will definitely be back the next time we are here.
I cannot think of a better place to have my first baby free date. The hospitality was excellent. The food was delicious. I cannot wait to go back here. It was just that good.

Excellent Korean food with some Japanese roll options.  Had the beef short ribs (galbi) and I had the mo deum jeon which is a combination of items.  Very fresh and delicious.  Owners are very friendly and nice.  We will be coming back here again!

The food was amazing, and the service was beyond amazing. The owners Mr. and Mrs. Lee were very friendly, Mr. Lee took the time to get to know us as we waited for the food, and brought out excellent appetizers, which were all complimentary. They really take pride in their food, and they brought out extra food we did not order because they wanted to share the food with us (again complementary, we were not charged for anything we didn't order). Mr. Lee told us that his restaurant is a playground, not a business. They're there because they love to be there. 

If you're one to be put off by a poor decor (they never painted the restaurant, or decorated it after taking ownership of the restaurant and changing it from M Sushi) then be prepared to be disappointed on that front. But that's not what this place is about at all, it's about the food, and amazing hospitality you rarely find, especially in Las Vegas.

First of all, I'd like to state that the hours on this page are wrong. This wonderful little restaurant is actually open from 11 AM-8:00 PM, Sun-Sat.

My boyfriend and I just moved to Henderson from San Diego, and we were in search of a good Korean restaurant in the area.  This is definitely the place!

Mr. Lee and his wife are both lovely people who really take pride in sharing their fresh, Korean home cooking. Our meal started with a creamy chicken soup, which was delicious. Mr. Lee even offered us seconds.

I ordered the mandugook (dumpling soup) and my boyfriend had the kalbi. Both dishes were delicious. Mrs. Lee makes the dumplings for the soup by hand, as opposed to the usual frozen dumplings at other Korean restaurants, and you can really tell the difference.

Also of note: the signs outside say "Korean food" and "M Sushi," which is a little confusing. Though there are a few sushi choices on the menu that look delicious (I can't wait to try the kimbap next), it is definitely more of a Korean restaurant. The location is right across the street from Green Valley Library, in the shopping center with Trader Joes.

This place really should be packed! We will definitely be frequenting it often now.

Great food, price and excellent service!The owner-husband and wife are excellent! On the house were creamy chicken soup, appetizers, pancakes and Japchae!!! Yes, that much and delicious as well!!! We are a family of 4.
Great location, tasty food, Friendly fast service it was truly a welcoming surprise. I highly recommend this place to my family and friends.

They're open from 11am until 8pm. 

I came in because of yelp, with my 15 year old son. I've been trying to get my son to eat Korean food for years with no success but he LOVES this restaurant! 

He highly recommends the Korean version of crispy pot stickers. Big, meaty...crunchy. My son said these were the best he's ever had, and he's had a lot.

I had the Soft Tofu soup/stew. I can see having this when I'm sick. It was so comforting. It came to the table boiling in a special pot. You crack a raw egg into it. You can also put your rice into the soup or eat it separately, or dip a spoon of rice into the broth quickly.  I ordered it med hot but I may order it spicy next time. It was immensely flavorful medium spicy too. 

The couple that runs this place is so friendly, it is them that makes me want to come back. So polite. So respectful. So graceful, friendly, and accommodating. I even got to practice a little Korean.

I asked if we could watch a little Korean TV and they gave me the remote. They also adjusted the blinds behind us so we wouldn't be in the sun. Also, they gave us both a starter of homemade creamy chicken soup. Its just enough to satisfy you as you wait for your order. If its too big it would room your appetite. This tiny bowl was perfect because our main meal made us very full and satisfied.

Also, we had many good selections of banchan/kimchi. The husband noticed we liked two in particular and asked if we would like more.

We also had a wonderful dessert soup at the end. I think I tasted barley and rice. I think it's called sikhye  Ask to be sure. It was a smooth, chilled, opaque and lightly sweetened drink that we sipped from small bowls. Very refreshing and light. A perfect way to end a meal .

We'll be back to explore the menu further. I cannot wait for next week! I think this is where we'll go before shopping at Trader Joes now.

Great family restaurant run by Ma and Pa. When my friend and I entered, there was nobody there (2 pm). I've done my research on other Yelp reviews and grabbed the menu from the counter. You get to choose wherever you want to sit.  
We were welcome by two great seniors who are from Korea. They are so cute! 

As an appetizer, Mr. Lee gave us a homemade creamy chicken soup. So creamy, healthy, and delicious! Though it was a small portion, I think they were preparing us for the amount of food my friend and I were about to devour. 

We had the Korean Style Family Roll, Bulgogi plate (8.50), Korean stir-fried noodles ($8.50), and beef bulgogi ($15.50) and Fried Vegatables (price unknown) served with a bowl of rice (make sure you mix it). All were so good; we didn't eat everything because we ordered a lot (well my girl did all of the ordering). By the time we were done, Mr. Lee then gave us a complimentary drink. He says it is to help digestion. Boy was he right because my friend and I were hungry after an hour hehe.

While you eat, Mr. Lee would check up on you, make some jokes, get to know you, and just have a great time. He's a great guy who knows how to smile on your face. I've learned that he used to be a chemical engineer and they've been living in the US for 25+ years. He also talks about his wife, which has been a registered nurse for 25 years for both Korea and California; now retired. She knows how to cook healthy, Korean food!

Service: 6/5 Food: 5/5 Check this place out! You won't leave dissapointed!

All of the five star ratings are spot-on. 

The owner/operators are friendly and really care about food quality, preparation, and service. We had a huge lunch and a lovely visit with Mr. Lee while he and his wife cooked our delicious meal. Wonderful!

Delicious food, very nice host, great service!!!  A small warm mom and pop restaurant, definitely a must when in the area, we had calbi rib, beef bulgigi, jap chae, and bibimbap all were delicious and would order again.

The other reviews say it all. This is a classic Mom and Pop. Just the two working the restaurant Its small, its quaint, and the food is good. 
They won't take a drink order, its mostly self serve out of the fridge. They get busy back in the kitchen so you might have to wait to check out. If these types of things bother you...don't come here. If you are in a hurry, don't come here.

They do fresh, homemade Korean food and its good. We got an appetizer soup shortly after we sat down, and then a few minutes later we ordered galbi, kimchi fried rice, and a shrimp tempura roll. Everything was very good, and plenty of food. 

This is definitely 4.5 stars. They are nice people. The restaurant is very basic, 6 tables and minimal decoration. The galbi was cooked perfect, the meat nice and tender and still a little red in the middle.

My husband and I finally tried this place the other night. Small little mom and pop place. Loved it. Genuinely nice couple, great service, and great food. The wife cooks the food herself. Portions were a good size too! We will definitely be back!
What happened?    Did the Lees hit the lottery and leave?    Will miss you.   Tried to come back to visit today

Since I love Korean food we thought we would check this place out thanks to my fellow Yelpers. 

Husband and wife team, no other servers, no other help.  Husband is a retired chemical engineer from Hyundai.  The Wife is a registered nurse who does all the cooking.  She insists on no MSG and no added sugar.  Nice.  The husband waits on you and chats you up while the wife cooks.  This is a long process since there is no other help. 

There is no liquor license.  Kind of a sore spot for us.  Three stars.  

The TV had Korean telenovelas on which I did not mind and reminded me of Korea, but my husband preferred something else.  It's hard to avoid.  

No AYCE and just single order items.  Banchan is small at first, but they will replace it as you need it.  Good Kimchi.  

Yes, it is nice the complimentary creamy soup at the beginning, but it did not seem to go with our meals and if your lactose intolerant, not a good move. 

We got pork and beef bulgolgi, spicy tuna roll and hot bi bim bap.  All was very good.  All took a long time to cook.   With a toddler, this was just too long for us. 

Absolutely a lovely couple, but not our thing.  We won't be back.
Great Korean restaurant run by husband and wife. Both are very hard working and can cook phenomenal food. They definitely deserve their high yelp review score.

The nicest people and excellent food. Even my super picky girlfriend who hates Asian food loved this place. Older man runs the front while his wife does the cooking. Tastes like you're eating dinner at the home of an older Korean couple. Excellent.

My girlfriend and I dined in last night for an amazing dinner. Pretty small place right next to Trader Joes. It was a sushi place as others have said. Now its a damn good Korean restaurant. 

You are given complimentary creamy chicken soup upon arrival, which neither I nor my girlfriend thought was very good. The creamy chicken soup tasted of raw flour, but it was free and I cant complain to much. We ordered bibimbop which was pretty good, it comes in a large stone bowl still sizzling. The best thing we ate was probably the pork bulgogi which was also served on a cast iron skillet still sizzling. The pork in the bulgogi was tender and flavorful. The complimentary rice, kimchi, seaweed salad were all very good as well. We ordered deep fried goyoza and i will order steamed next time, good filling, but to crispy. 

There was also a last minute surprise from are server (possibly the owner as well), he threw in some complimentary beef jap chae, which was amazing. I love the thin glass noodles and pretty much everything about this dish. My girlfriend said it was a bit greasy, but okay for me.
The owners were so welcoming and the food was great! They made sure we had everything we wanted plus more.
If you enjoy korean japanese home style cooking...you have to visit this place, very authentic and affordable...
